ygData.messageBody:
I agree. Basically, Verant feels the need to alter the
game balance by nerfing from character classes. This may
be part of a larger effort to help the pure melee classes.
In any case, I think they have come to the conclusion that
if they can do it silently, no one may notice or be
able to prove it. This lets them avoid any headaches dealing
with pesky paying customers.

The problem with this stealth nerfing policy is that it gets
characters killed who havent been notified of the changes and
attempt to do something that has always succeeded in the past.
As paying customers, I believe that everyone has the right to
be informed of any substantive changes that affect the gameplay
that we all pay for. That is why I suggest thated a clause on
stealth nerfing be placed in the Bard petition (Bards seem to
have been victimized a couple of times by this). On the other
hand, it may be more worthwhile to start a separate petition
demanding that Verant publish and adhere to an Open Disclosure
Agreement that commits them to release these types of changes
immediately upon implementing them. The "knife in the dark"
stealth nerfing policy is very unprofessional.


-----Original Message-----
From: Abraham Hardjana [mailto:ahardjan@...]
Sent: Tuesday, August 10, 1999 9:44 AM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Missed notes on songs.


From: Abraham Hardjana <ahardjan@...>

On Tue, 10 Aug 1999, Chris Kuenster (Entex) wrote:
<snip>
> note on these songs. There can only be one explanation for missing as many
> notes as I am, Verant botched the patch! I know it sounds hard to believe,
> but its the only reason I am all of a sudden having this problem. Any
other
> explanation is crap. We only started having this problem when they patched
> the the Missed Notes on high level songs last patch. We all need to /bug
and
> /petition this everynight to get it fixed, or get a real explanation of
> whats going on.

I think I mentioned this before, but let me do it again. It is my
personal opinion that Verant may be nerfing casters silently. This is
particularly noticable on your earlier songs/spells where you very rarely
fizzle. miss a not or are interrupted. As of last night my level 17
magician on a full bar of mana in combat fizzle twice and was interrupted
five or six times while trying to cast shock of blades. Please not that
Shock of Blades is a lvl 8 DD spell that I have been using since I got it.
My skill is maxed for my level. So this may be a nerf for casters which I
think it might be, I would not put it past Verant for nerfing something
without telling us at all.

Treilanin Loreweaver Level 22 Bard
Aariel lvl 17 Magician
Honour Guard, Karana
